Sentencas: Laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-RIS) was used for the direct analysis of ceramic layers [L(0.65)Sr(0.3)MnO(3) and yttria-stabilized ZrO2 (YSZ)] forming parts of solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Analysis of ceramic layers for solid oxide fuel cells by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Sentencas: For the quantitative determination of trace element concentrations calibration was performed with matrix-matched synthetic laboratory standards, prepared specially for these ceramic materials.
Titulo: Analysis of ceramic layers for solid oxide fuel cells by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Sentencas: With a few exceptions the regression coefficients of the calibration curves were better than 0.995 (n=15).
Titulo: Analysis of ceramic layers for solid oxide fuel cells by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Sentencas: The detection limits for most elements are in the range 0.1-2 mu g g(-1) in La0.65Sr0.3MnO3 and YSZ.
Titulo: Analysis of ceramic layers for solid oxide fuel cells by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Sentencas: Investigations on ceramics, doped with trace elements with concentrations of some 100 mu g g(-1) showed lower concentrations of the elements than were added, offing to the sintering process at temperatures of 1400 degrees C.
Titulo: Analysis of ceramic layers for solid oxide fuel cells by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Sentencas: In non-doped YSZ layers different elements were determined at concentrations from sub-mu g g(-1) to hundreds of mu g g(-1).
Titulo: Analysis of ceramic layers for solid oxide fuel cells by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Sentencas: The results were found to be in good agreement with those obtained by other methods (ICP-MS and radiofrequency glow discharge mass spectrometry).
Titulo: Analysis of ceramic layers for solid oxide fuel cells by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy
